definition: Overflights (helicopter, fixed wing, or drone) with documented flight lines, coverage, visibility, and sensor settings. Imagery may be reviewed post-flight.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Integrates serial counts over time using a survey-life parameter; may apply observer efficiency.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: Regression/state-space model calibrated to a Type-1/2 series converts a lower-precision index to abundance.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: Effort-standardized electrofishing passes used to generate catch-per-unit-effort (CPUE) indices.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: A method used to enumerate or count salmon in the field
related_terms: Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: The number of mature salmon that pass through (or escape) fisheries and return to fresh water to spawn.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf
related_terms: process (subClassOf) [http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_0000015]

definition: A measurement or estimate of escapement tied to a stock and a survey event.
related_terms: measurement datum (subClassOf) [http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/IAO_0000109]

definition: A survey event specifically for estimating escapement.
related_terms: Survey event (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#SurveyEvent]

definition: A method used to analyze and estimate salmon abundance from enumeration data
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]

definition: Applies expansion factors or arithmetic transforms to a base count/index.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: Automated counting at a constrained opening using electronic/optical counters, resistivity counters, or video/camera systems. QA review of automated events, cross-section coverage, and uptime/coverage are documented.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Salmon are guided through a controlled opening in a fence/weir where trained observers visually tally each passage event on a continuous or daily schedule. Counting chambers/windows and SIL/SEN daily logs document coverage; bypass routes are monitored and closed where possible.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Seasonal total = roll‑up of daily/continuous counts from a fixed (non‑sonar) station; simple arithmetic with documented coverage.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: Model pipeline converts sonar detections to passage totals; sets range/angle/blind zones; species/size attribution rules documented.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: Sonar detections (ARIS, DIDSON, or other hydroacoustic systems) with documented coverage, visibility/noise conditions, and uptime. Raw detections require processing through a modelling/classification pipeline.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Indicator streams are those that have been identified in some Regions as providing more reliable indices of spawner abundance. Indicator streams tend to give relatively accurate annual spawner abundance estimates, given that they use higher quality methodologies and are more intensively/regularly surveyed. Indicator streams are also assumed to be representative of spawner returns to other streams in close geographic proximity.
Capture-recapture estimators (Petersen, Jolly-Seber, open/Bayesian models) applied to field marks/recoveries.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: Field program involving marking and subsequent recapture/recovery of tagged fish with documented assumptions and recovery coverage.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Uses the peak survey (live ± dead variants) as the season estimate/index.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: Redd counts with documentation of detectability, timing, and reach coverage. Conversion to spawner estimates requires spawners-per-redd factors handled in analysis.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Converts redd counts to spawner estimates using spawners-per-redd expansion factors.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: A field event that collects information about key fish stocks to track their status, and track progress to implement fishery policies and measures for these stocks.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). About the Sustainability Survey for Fisheries. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/survey-sondage/about-propos-en.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). About the Sustainability Survey for Fisheries. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/survey-sondage/about-propos-en.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
related_terms: Event (subClassOf) [http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/Event]

definition: Trap-based counts from non-spanning traps with documented emptying schedule, efficiency measurements, and coverage information.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Trap-based counts adjusted with efficiency/coverage models to estimate total passage.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethodScheme]; Estimate Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateMethod]

definition: Visual surveys conducted by stream/bank walk with documented visit schedule, reach coverage, timing, and visibility conditions.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]

definition: Two or more trained snorkelers conduct standardized passes within defined segments, tallying live/dead by species. Field forms capture visibility class, segment boundaries, and repeat-visit schedule; counts are aggregated across observers/passes.
related_terms: Enumeration Method (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethod]; Escapement Enumeration Method Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EnumerationMethodScheme]
